You are given an array of $n$ integers. You can perform the following operations on the array:

1. **Add:** Choose an index $i$ ($1 \le i \le n$) and an integer $x$ ($0 \le x \le 10^6$). Add $x$ to each element of the array from index 1 to $i$.
2. **Mod:** Choose an index $i$ ($1 \le i \le n$) and an integer $x$ ($1 \le x \le 10^6$). Replace each element of the array from index 1 to $i$ with the remainder when the element is divided by $x$.

Determine the minimum number of operations required to make the array strictly increasing. Output the number of operations and a list of the operations performed.

You are given a list of numbers. You can perform two types of operations:

1. Add a given number to all numbers in a prefix of the list.
2. Take the remainder when each number in a prefix of the list is divided by a given number.

Can you make the list strictly increasing using at most one more operation than the length of the list? If so, describe the operations needed.
